Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error : The local source '/home/gysun/myNuGetServer' doesn't exist." (#9922) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet Version: 5.5.0.6382
.NET Core SDK (3.0.101)
OS version (ubuntu-16.04):

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. nuget sources Add -Name "MyServer" -Source /home/gysun/myNugetServer
2. nuget add new_package.1.0.0.nupkg -source /home/gysun/myNugetServer
3. git clone https://github.com/dotnet/corefx.git ;cd corefx
4. vim NuGet.config and add 
           <add key="MyServer" value="/home/gysun/myNuGetServer" /> 
5. then run 
          ./build.sh --configuration Debug --arch arm64 /p:DisableCrossgen=true /p:PortableBuild=true /p:SkipTests=true
    then error is :
      /corefx/.dotnet/sdk/3.0.100/NuGet.targets(123,5): error : The local source '/home/gysun/myNuGetServer' doesn't exist. [/corefx/external/runtime/runtime.depproj]


so , I don`t know to add a local souce to NuGet.config. I want get a help ,thank you very much!

Events.RelatedBody: PM UI needs to abstract the use of PackageReference to better support serializability for online scenarios.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet Target framework information breaking change coordination" (#9911) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In 16.8 P2, NuGet made a breaking change where we started reading the TargetFramework* and TargetPlatform* properties from the inner build.
This means that the framework detection across NuGet & SDK needed to change. 

In additional .NET 5 SDK, P7 and earlier, misreported the TargetPlatformMoniker for net5.0 projects as `Windows,Version=7.0`. 

Other notable challenges are that in 16.8 P2, NuGet used TargetPlatformIdentifier and TargetPLatformVersion, but in 16.8 P3 NuGet will use TargetPlatformMoniker. https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3578. 

So this is meant to coordinate the insertions necessary to get 16.8 P2 and 16.8 P3 in a happy state. 

- [x] NuGet -> VS (16.8 P2) [PR](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/267136) (done)
- [x] NuGet -> SDK (.NET 5 P8 & .NET 5 RC1)
  - @sfoslund in charge https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/462, https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12915 and https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12897 (the main tracking issue)
  - Approved by tactics!
  - Merged into preview.8 (not master, yet?)
- [x] NuGet -> project-system (16.8 P2) https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/pull/6495 - This allows NuGet in VS 16.8 P2 and 16.8 P3 to work continuously.
- [x] Further insertion blocked (Charles and Peter)
  - https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/267767?_a=overview
  - https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/268099?_a=files
- [x] Insertions pending SDK changes
  - https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12944
  - https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12943
  - Estimated to land the night of 2020/08/17 (Monday), possibly early Tuesday
  - Once these are merged, insertion can be attempted again (and those will take a while to do their runs)
  - Matt will make sure drop gets pulled
- [x] SDK -> VS (.NET 5 P8 with NuGet to VS 16.8 P2)
  - @wli3 will be taking point on this
  - He will target https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS?version=GBdev%2Fvslsnap%2Finsertions%2Fmaster.20200814130317 instead of 16.8 or master (because project system changes need SDK changes to pass DDRITS and vice versa)
  - SDK has flowed into the installer branch: https://dnceng.visualstudio.com/internal/_build/results?buildId=772035&view=results
- [x] project-system -> VS (16.8 P2) (See email thread for status, JJ and microbuild are on this. Tracking issue for insertion: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/268099 )
  - master got locked, so PR 267767 had to be redirected to main

cc @zkat

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Move ToolWindow creation to AsyncPackage APIs" (#9570) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Calls to uiShell.CreateToolWindow (in Nuget Codespaces) should be replaced with their appropriate counterparts in AsyncPackage, documented here: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.visualstudio.shell.asyncpackage?view=visualstudiosdk-2019](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.visualstudio.shell.asyncpackage?view=visualstudiosdk-2019)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pack tells me it will exclude folder starting with dot, but does not" (#9921) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Version info

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): **NuGet.exe**

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): **5.6.0.6591**

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): **Win10 Version 2004 (OS Build20195.1000)**

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: **don't know**

## Description

"Nuget pack" is including my ".git" directory, even though it says it will exclude files and folders that start with a dot ('.'). Additionally, I have not been able to craft an exclude directive that will successfully exclude my .git directory.

### details

I keep my project in source control using git, so I have a .git directory and .gitignore file in the root of my project.

My project is very simple... just a PowerShell script module. So my "content" starts at the root directory.

Sample file layout:

```
PS E:\temp\nugetProblem2> dir -Recurse

    Directory: E:\temp\nugetProblem2

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----           8/17/2020  8:10 PM                .git
-a---           8/17/2020  8:13 PM              4 .gitignore
-a---           8/17/2020  8:18 PM            309 nugetProblem.nuspec
-a---           8/17/2020  8:09 PM             52 ReadMe.txt

    Directory: E:\temp\nugetProblem2\.git

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
-a---           8/17/2020  8:10 PM              4 shouldNotBePacked.txt

PS E:\temp\nugetProblem2>
```
When I run "nuget pack", it very clearly tells me:

```
WARNING: NU5119: File 'E:\temp\nugetProblem2\.gitignore' was not added to the package. Files and folders starting with '.' or ending with '.nupkg' are excluded by default.
```

And in fact it *does* exclude the ".gitignore" file. But it does **NOT** exclude the ".git" directory.

On top of that, I have not been able to come up with an "exclude" directive, either on the command line or in the .nuspec file, to exclude the ".git" directory.

### Repro steps, with sample project

Attached is a sample/dummy project that will reproduce the problem:
[nugetProblem.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5087988/nugetProblem.zip)

**Repro steps:**
1. Extract the sample project.
2. In the root of the sample project directory, run "nuget pack".
3. Observe the warning message about how "Files and folders starting with '.'" will not be packed.
4. Rename the resulting .nupkg to .zip and open it up.

**Expected result:**
The .git folder should not be in the package.

**Actual result:**
The .git folder is in the package.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
